reasoning: The loop creates one subplot per column, but the grid size is fixed at 2 rows by (len(df.columns)//2 + 1) columns; if df has more than 2*(len(df.columns)//2 + 1) columns, indexing ax[index] will go out of range. This is likely for typical datasets with many columns.

Creates a 2xN grid of axes but only enough for half the columns; iterating over all df columns will exceed ax size causing IndexError. Also boxplot y expects numeric; but main crash is index out of range.
The subplot grid has more axes than columns, but indexing only increments up to the number of columns, which is safe. Seaborn boxplot with y=col and data=df is valid.

The grid has 2*(len(columns)//2+1) axes, which may be fewer than the number of columns; if df has more columns than axes, indexing ax[index] will go out of range. Also sns.boxplot with y=col and data=df is valid. Possible IndexError but not certain without column count.
Subplots grid has 2*(len(df.columns)//2+1) axes, which is >= number of columns, so indexing is safe; seaborn boxplot with y=col and data=df is valid. No undefined variables or imports missing.
